name: Lemon and White Wine Shrimp Scampi with Asparagus
author: Russ
summary: Bright and fresh shrimp scampi pasta with wine and lemon juice! Sometimes I just throw the asparagus right in with it because it comes out so good! I've tried several white wines with this, but my favorite flavor is with a Sauvignon Blanc. You can also make this with scallops and thin spaghetti.
ingredients: 3 cloves garlic, minced, or to taste
4  lemons, juiced, or more to taste
1 pound small shrimp, peeled and deveined
1 pinch Italian seasoning, or to taste
1 tablespoon grated Parmesan cheese, or to taste
directions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water and 1 tablespoon olive oil to a boil
Cook linguine at a boil until tender yet firm to the bite, about 11 minutes
Heat remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large, deep skillet over medium-high heat
Add onion; cook and stir until softened and translucent, 2 to 3 minutes
Stir in garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute
Pour in juice of 2 lemons and stir well
Add asparagus; cook until softened, 2 to 3 minutes
Reduce heat; simmer until thickened and reduced, 5 to 7 minutes
Stir in shrimp; cook until they are bright pink on the outside and the meat is opaque, 4 to 5 minutes
Mix in remaining lemon juice and capers until you have reached your desired flavor
Season with Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper
